1 import numpy as np
2 import cv2
3 from niryo_robot_vision.math_functions import euclidean_dist_2_pts
4 
5 IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS = 200
6 
7 
8 def extract_img_markers(img, workspace_ratio=1.0):
9  """
10  Extract working area from an image thanks to 4 Niryo's markers
11  :param img: OpenCV image which contain 4 Niryo's markers
12  :param workspace_ratio: Ratio between the width and the height of the area represented by the markers
13  :return: extracted and warped working area image
14  """
15 
16  gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
17 
18  img_thresh = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(gray, maxValue=255, adaptiveMethod=cv2.ADAPTIVE_THRESH_MEAN_C,
19  thresholdType=cv2.THRESH_BINARY, blockSize=15, C=25)
20 
21  list_good_candidates = find_markers_from_img_thresh(img_thresh)
22  if not list_good_candidates or len(list_good_candidates) > 6:
23  return None
24 
25  if len(list_good_candidates) == 4:
26  list_good_candidates = sort_markers_detection(list_good_candidates)
27  else:
28  list_good_candidates = complicated_sort_markers(list_good_candidates, workspace_ratio=workspace_ratio)
29  if list_good_candidates is None:
30  return None
31 
32  im_cut = extract_sub_img(img, list_good_candidates, ratio_w_h=workspace_ratio)
33  return im_cut
34 
35 
36 def extract_sub_img(img, list_corners, ratio_w_h=1.0):
37  """
38  Extract an small image from a big one using a Perspective Warp
39  :param img: Big image from which the small one will be extracted
40  :param list_corners: corners list of the small image
41  :param ratio_w_h: Width over Height ratio of the area. It helps to not stretch the working area image
42  :return: extracted and warped image
43  """
44  if list_corners is None or len(list_corners) != 4:
45  return None
46 
47  if ratio_w_h >= 1.0:
48  target_w_area = int(round(ratio_w_h * IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS))
49  target_h_area = IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS
50  else:
51  ratio_w_h = 1.0 / ratio_w_h
52  target_h_area = int(round(ratio_w_h * IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS))
53  target_w_area = IM_EXTRACT_SMALL_SIDE_PIXELS
54 
55  points_grid = []
56 
57  for marker in list_corners:
58  points_grid.append(marker.get_center())
59  points_grid = np.array(points_grid, dtype=np.float32)
60  final_pts = np.array(
61  [[0, 0], [target_w_area - 1, 0],
62  [target_w_area - 1, target_h_area - 1], [0, target_h_area - 1]],
63  dtype=np.float32)
64  transfo_matrix = cv2.getPerspectiveTransform(points_grid, final_pts)
65  # print transfo_matrix
66  # print np.linalg.det(transfo_matrix)
67  area_im = cv2.warpPerspective(img, transfo_matrix, (target_w_area, target_h_area))
68  return area_im
69 
70 
71 def draw_markers(img, workspace_ratio=1.0):
72  gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
73 
74  img_thresh = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(gray, maxValue=255, adaptiveMethod=cv2.ADAPTIVE_THRESH_MEAN_C,
75  thresholdType=cv2.THRESH_BINARY, blockSize=15, C=32)
76 
77  list_good_candidates = find_markers_from_img_thresh(img_thresh)
78  if not list_good_candidates:
79  return False, img
80  im_draw = img.copy()
81  for marker in list_good_candidates:
82  cx, cy = marker.get_center()
83  radius = marker.get_radius()
84  cv2.circle(im_draw, (cx, cy), radius, (0, 0, 255), 2)
85  if len(list_good_candidates) > 6:
86  return False, im_draw
87 
88  if len(list_good_candidates) == 4:
89  list_good_candidates = sort_markers_detection(list_good_candidates)
90  else:
91  list_good_candidates = complicated_sort_markers(list_good_candidates, workspace_ratio=workspace_ratio)
92  if list_good_candidates is None:
93  return False, im_draw
94 
95  for i, marker in enumerate(list_good_candidates[:4]):
96  cx, cy = marker.get_center()
97  radius = marker.get_radius()
98  cv2.circle(im_draw, (cx, cy), radius, (0, 200, 0), 2)
99  cv2.putText(im_draw, "{}".format(i + 1),
100  (cx + 5, cy - 15), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.9, (0, 0, 0), 3)
101  cv2.putText(im_draw, "{}".format(i + 1),
102  (cx + 5, cy - 15), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 0.9, (0, 200, 0), 2)
103  return True, im_draw

106 class PotentialMarker:
107  def __init__(self, center, radius, cnt):
108  self.center = center
109  self.x = center[0]
110  self.y = center[1]
111  self.radius = radius
112  self.contour = cnt
113  self.is_merged = False
114 
115  def get_center(self):
116  return self.center
117 
118  def __str__(self):
119  return "{} - {} - {}".format(self.x, self.y, self.radius)
120 
121  def __repr__(self):
122  return self.__str__()
123 
124 
125 class Marker:
126  def __init__(self, potential_marker):
127  self.list_centers = [potential_marker.get_center()]
128  self.list_radius = [potential_marker.radius]
129  self.list_contours = [potential_marker.contour]
130  self.cx = self.list_centers[0][0]
131  self.cy = self.list_centers[0][1]
132  self.radius = potential_marker.radius
133  self.identifiant = None
134  self.value_for_id = None
135 
136  def get_radius(self):
137  return self.radius
138 
139  def get_center(self):
140  return self.cx, self.cy
141 
142  def add_circle(self, obj_potential_marker):
143  self.list_centers.append(obj_potential_marker.get_center())
144  self.list_radius.append(obj_potential_marker.radius)
145  obj_potential_marker.is_merged = True
146 
147  (x, y) = np.mean(self.list_centers, axis=0)
148  self.cx, self.cy = int(round(x)), int(round(y))
149 
150  self.radius = int(round(max(self.list_radius)))
151 
152  def nb_circles(self):
153  return len(self.list_centers)
154 
155  def get_id_from_slice(self, img_thresh):
156  x, y, w, h = self.cx - 1, self.cy - 1, 3, 3
157  self.value_for_id = np.mean(img_thresh[y:y + h, x:x + w])
158  # return value_for_id
159  if self.value_for_id > 200:
160  self.identifiant = "A"
161  else:
162  self.identifiant = "B"
163 
164  return self.identifiant
165  # return value_for_id
166 
167  def __str__(self):
168  return "{} - {}".format(self.nb_circles(), self.list_centers)
169 
170  def __repr__(self):
171  return self.__str__()
172 
173 
174 def sort_markers_detection(list_markers):
175  def rotate_list(list_, n):
176  return list_[n:] + list_[:n]
177 
178  list_sort_y = sorted(list_markers, key=lambda m: m.cy)
179 
180  top1, top2, bottom1, bottom2 = list_sort_y
181 
182  if top1.cx < top2.cx:
183  top_left = top1
184  top_right = top2
185  else:
186  top_left = top2
187  top_right = top1
188 
189  if bottom1.cx < bottom2.cx:
190  bottom_left = bottom1
191  bottom_right = bottom2
192  else:
193  bottom_left = bottom2
194  bottom_right = bottom1
195 
196  list_markers_unsorted = [top_left, top_right, bottom_right, bottom_left]
197  list_id = [marker.identifiant for marker in list_markers_unsorted]
198 
199  if list_id.count("A") == 1:
200  list_corners_sorted = rotate_list(list_markers_unsorted, n=list_id.index("A"))
201  elif list_id.count("B") == 1:
202  list_corners_sorted = rotate_list(list_markers_unsorted, n=list_id.index("B"))
203  else:
204  return list_markers_unsorted
205 
206  return list_corners_sorted
207 
208 
209 def complicated_sort_markers(list_markers, workspace_ratio):
210  import itertools
211 
212  if workspace_ratio >= 1.0:
213  target_w_area = int(round(workspace_ratio * 200))
214  target_h_area = 200
215  else:
216  ratio_w_h = 1.0 / workspace_ratio
217  target_h_area = int(round(ratio_w_h * 200))
218  target_w_area = 200
219  list_id = [marker.identifiant for marker in list_markers]
220  count_type_a = list_id.count("A")
221  count_type_b = list_id.count("B")
222  if count_type_a < 3 > count_type_b:
223  return None
224  if count_type_a < count_type_b:
225  id_first_marker = "A"
226  id_second_marker = "B"
227  else:
228  id_first_marker = "B"
229  id_second_marker = "A"
230  list_combinaisons = []
231  list_marker_1 = [marker for marker in list_markers if marker.identifiant == id_first_marker]
232  list_marker_2 = [marker for marker in list_markers if marker.identifiant == id_second_marker]
233  if list_marker_1:
234  list_combinaisons_marker_2 = itertools.combinations(list_marker_2, 3)
235  for marker1 in list_marker_1:
236  for combi_markers2 in list_combinaisons_marker_2:
237  combin = [marker1] + list(combi_markers2)
238 
239  list_combinaisons.append(sort_markers_detection(combin))
240  else:
241  for combinaison in itertools.combinations(list_marker_2, 4):
242  list_combinaisons.append(combinaison)
243  if not list_combinaisons:
244  return None
245 
246  final_pts = np.array(
247  [[0, 0], [target_w_area - 1, 0],
248  [target_w_area - 1, target_h_area - 1], [0, target_h_area - 1]],
249  dtype=np.float32)
250  list_det_transfo_matrix = []
251  for combin in list_combinaisons:
252  points_grid = np.array([[mark.cx, mark.cy] for mark in combin], dtype=np.float32)
253 
254  transfo_matrix = cv2.getPerspectiveTransform(points_grid, final_pts)
255  list_det_transfo_matrix.append(np.linalg.det(transfo_matrix))
256 
257  best_combin_ind = np.argmin(abs(np.array(list_det_transfo_matrix) - 1))
258  best_markers = list_combinaisons[best_combin_ind]
259  return best_markers
260 
261 
262 def find_markers_from_img_thresh(img_thresh, max_dist_between_centers=3, min_radius_circle=4,
263  max_radius_circle=35, min_radius_marker=7):
264  contours = cv2.findContours(img_thresh, cv2.RETR_LIST, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)[-2]
265  list_potential_markers = []
266  for cnt in contours:
267  (x, y), radius = cv2.minEnclosingCircle(cnt)
268  if not min_radius_circle < radius < max_radius_circle:
269  continue
270  center = (int(round(x)), int(round(y)))
271  radius = int(radius)
272  list_potential_markers.append(PotentialMarker(center, radius, cnt))
273 
274  list_potential_markers = sorted(list_potential_markers, key=lambda m: m.x)
275  list_good_candidates = []
276 
277  for i, potential_marker in enumerate(list_potential_markers):
278  if potential_marker.is_merged:
279  continue
280  marker1 = Marker(potential_marker)
281  center_marker = marker1.get_center()
282 
283  for potential_marker2 in list_potential_markers[i + 1:]:
284  if potential_marker.is_merged:
285  continue
286  center_potential = potential_marker2.get_center()
287  if center_potential[0] - center_marker[0] > max_dist_between_centers:
288  break
289  dist = euclidean_dist_2_pts(center_marker, center_potential)
290  if dist <= max_dist_between_centers:
291  marker1.add_circle(potential_marker2)
292  center_marker = marker1.get_center()
293 
294  if marker1.nb_circles() > 2 and marker1.radius >= min_radius_marker:
295  list_good_candidates.append(marker1)
296  marker1.get_id_from_slice(img_thresh)
297 
298  return list_good_candidates
